211 End.

CVE-2018-15919.summary: Remotely observable behaviour in auth-gss2.c in OpenSSH through 7.8 could be used by remote attackers to detect existence of users on a target system when GSS2 is in use. NOTE: the discoverer states 'We understand that the OpenSSH developers do not want to treat such a username enumeration (or "oracle") as a vulnerability.'

CVE-2018-15473.summary: OpenSSH through 7.7 is prone to a user enumeration vulnerability due to not delaying bailout for an invalid authenticating user until after the packet containing the request has been fully parsed, related to auth2-gss.c, auth2-hostbased.c, and auth2-pubkey.c.

CVE-2017-15906.summary: The process_open function in sftp-server.c in OpenSSH before 7.6 does not properly prevent write operations in readonly mode, which allows attackers to create zero-length files.

In the News

Newly Elected Fire Chiefs Sworn In

On April 4, 2019, Mayor Michael Lavorata swore in the newly elected chiefs of the Lindenhurst Fire Department. Mayor Lavorata congratulated the chiefs on their election and thanked them for their hard work and selfless dedication to our Village. Mayor Lavorata said, “I cannot thank the members of the Lindenhurst Fire Department enough because when […]

Read More

Upcoming Events

Current Month

april 2019

The color Palette Art Studio 51 West Hoffman Avenue, Lindenhurst, NY 11757

11apr7:00 pmRotary Club Paint Night7:00 pm

Event Details

The Lindenhurst Rotary Club will

Event Details

The Lindenhurst Rotary Club will be holding a paint night at The Color Palette Art Studio on April 11, 2019 at 7:00 PM. Participants will be painting a tray, perfect for entertaining or a table top decoration! The tray is 16″ x 12″ x 2″ with a few different festive designs available to paint. The fee is $35.00 per person.

Space is limited so reserve your spot! Make checks payable to Gaye Kienle and forward to 90 Byrd Street. Lindenhurst, NY 11757.

First come first serve.

Time

(Thursday) 7:00 pm

Location

The color Palette Art Studio

51 West Hoffman Avenue, Lindenhurst, NY 11757

* Up to two events will show here.
Click the button below for a full event listing.
View Full Events Calendar

Mayor’s Message

Spring has sprung and with each springtime there is new life brought to Earth in the form of blooming flowers, plant buds, trees and greenery everywhere.  2019 promises to be a major year for this Village as we continue to see our downtown develop into a new landscape which is both business and family friendly.  […]
